Selected Answer: A
A - terraform plan -refresh-only
A. terraform plan -refresh-only

A. The -refresh-only flag with the terraform plan command updates the state file with the current state of the real resources, without applying any changes. This command compares the current state of the infrastructure with the Terraform configuration and updates the state file with any changes that were made externally.

choices.B: Once the resource provider has fulfilled the request
choices.D: None of the above are correct
choices.A: After Terraform has updated the state file

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
seems like B is the correct answer, it depends on provider has complete the request first

comments.content: Changes take effect once the resource provider (e.g., AWS, Azure) has fulfilled the request. This means the infrastructure has been successfully modified as per the plan
